channel.title: Reinforcement Learning on StatWizard
channel.description: Recent content in Reinforcement Learning on StatWizard

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 5) - Q Learning and Optimal Policy Finding
item.description: This is the 5th part of the Reinforcement Learning Series: Here I discuss about techniques to finding optimal policies, and then demonstrate the popular Q-learning algorithm. I also show how it can be implemented to solve actual problems

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 4) - Temporal Difference Algorithms
item.description: This is the 4th part of the Reinforcement Learning Series: Here I discuss about how the idea of Bellman equations and Monte Carlo methods can be combined into a single algorithm called Temporal Difference. We will also learn about its variants and how we can use it to estimate the value functions.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 3) - Markov Decision Process
item.description: This is the third part of the Reinforcement Learning series: Here I discuss about the representing the reinforcement learning problem as a markov decision process, explain standard terminologies and provide ways to estimate the value function.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 2) - K-arm Bandit Problem
item.description: This is the second part of the Reinforcement Learning series: Here I discuss about dynamically balancing between exploration and exploitation to reach optimal return in long run.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (Part 1) - K-arm Bandit Problem
item.description: This is an introductory post about reinforcement learning. Here I discuss about the exploration-exploitation dilemma with multi-armed bandit problem and potential solutions to this.
